pull.title: refactor: Fix implicit value conversion in  formatPingTime
pull.body:
Alternative to #18252, see motivation there.

This changes `CNodeStats` to handle ping timestamps as their original incoming usec `int64_t` values until the time they need to be displayed.

issue.title: gui: fix compiler warning in formatPingTime()
issue.body:
With Clang 10.0.0:

```
qt/guiutil.cpp:778:26: warning: implicit conversion from 'std::__1::numeric_limits<long>::type'
      (aka 'long') to 'double' changes value from 9223372036854775807 to 9223372036854775808
      [-Wimplicit-int-float-conversion]
    return (dPingTime == std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()/1e6 || dPingTime == 0) ? QObject::...
                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

When assigning to `dPingTime` a similar typecast is used:

```
src/net.cpp:558:    stats.dPingTime = (((double)nPingUsecTime) / 1e6);
```

so it should be ok to change 9223372036854775807 to 9223372036854775808.

* Refactoring changes are only accepted if they are required for a feature or

  is often a subjective matter. Unless they are explicitly mentioned to be
  preferred in the [developer notes](/doc/developer-notes.md), stylistic code
  changes are usually rejected.

events.message:
refactor: Cast ping values to double before output

Note the divisor is a floating point literal so presumably
also floating point.

events.body: ACK 1891245e7318bf625bbf67aab08a79fc3e87b61d, added cast to double and also braces.

ACK 1891245

I tested this with Clang 10 and [the warning](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18252#issue-382935046) is gone.

Nit: the cast to `double` added in 1891245 is not necessary (I am ok with it).
Would be nice to add (functional) tests for this, since it is uncovered right now.

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

comments.body: Indeed, I tend to prefer the explicit numerator cast though.
